pageProps.contentHtml:
Cauchy's integral formula

Let F ⁣:C×C→C\func{F}{\C \times \C}{\C}F:C×C→C be (jointly) continuous and holomorphic in each variable separately. Show that z↦F(z,z)z \mapsto F\p{z, z}z↦F(z,z) is holomorphic.
Solution.

Fix z0∈Cz_0 \in \Cz0​∈C and let z∈B(z0,1)z \in B\p{z_0, 1}z∈B(z0​,1). Observe that because FFF is holomorphic in the first variable,

F(z,z)=12πi∫∂B(z0,1)F(ζ,z)ζ−z dζ,F\p{z, z} = \frac{1}{2\pi i} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 1}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, z}}{\zeta - z} \,\diff\zeta,F(z,z)=2πi1​∫∂B(z0​,1)​ζ−zF(ζ,z)​dζ,

by Cauchy's integral formula. Since for each ζ\zetaζ, z↦F(ζ,z)z \mapsto F\p{\zeta, z}z↦F(ζ,z) is still holomorphic, we get

F(ζ,z)=12πi∫∂B(z0,2)F(ζ,w)w−z dw.F\p{\zeta, z} = \frac{1}{2\pi i} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 2}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, w}}{w - z} \,\diff{w}.F(ζ,z)=2πi1​∫∂B(z0​,2)​w−zF(ζ,w)​dw.

Combining these, we get

F(z,z)=1(2πi)2∫∂B(z0,2)∫∂B(z0,3)F(ζ,w)(ζ−z)(w−z) dw dζ=1(2πi)2∫∂B(z0,2)∫∂B(z0,3)F(ζ,w)ζ−w(1w−z−1ζ−z) dw dζ=1(2πi)2∫∂B(z0,2)∫∂B(z0,3)F(ζ,w)ζ−w∑n=0∞[1w(z−z0w−z0)n−1ζ−z0(z−z0ζ−z0)n] dw dζ=1(2πi)2∫∂B(z0,2)∫∂B(z0,3)F(ζ,w)ζ−w∑n=0∞(1(w−z0)n+1−1(ζ−z0)n+1)(z−z0)n dw dζ.\begin{aligned} F\p{z, z} &= \frac{1}{\p{2\pi i}^2} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 2}} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 3}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, w}}{\p{\zeta - z}\p{w - z}} \,\diff{w} \,\diff\zeta \\ &= \frac{1}{\p{2\pi i}^2} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 2}} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 3}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, w}}{\zeta - w}\p{\frac{1}{w - z} - \frac{1}{\zeta - z}} \,\diff{w} \,\diff\zeta \\ &= \frac{1}{\p{2\pi i}^2} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 2}} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 3}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, w}}{\zeta - w}\sum_{n=0}^\infty \br{\frac{1}{w}\p{\frac{z - z_0}{w - z_0}}^n - \frac{1}{\zeta - z_0}\p{\frac{z - z_0}{\zeta - z_0}}^n} \,\diff{w} \,\diff\zeta \\ &= \frac{1}{\p{2\pi i}^2} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 2}} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 3}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, w}}{\zeta - w}\sum_{n=0}^\infty \p{\frac{1}{\p{w - z_0}^{n+1}} - \frac{1}{\p{\zeta - z_0}^{n+1}}} \p{z - z_0}^n \,\diff{w} \,\diff\zeta. \end{aligned}F(z,z)​=(2πi)21​∫∂B(z0​,2)​∫∂B(z0​,3)​(ζ−z)(w−z)F(ζ,w)​dwdζ=(2πi)21​∫∂B(z0​,2)​∫∂B(z0​,3)​ζ−wF(ζ,w)​(w−z1​−ζ−z1​)dwdζ=(2πi)21​∫∂B(z0​,2)​∫∂B(z0​,3)​ζ−wF(ζ,w)​n=0∑∞​[w1​(w−z0​z−z0​​)n−ζ−z0​1​(ζ−z0​z−z0​​)n]dwdζ=(2πi)21​∫∂B(z0​,2)​∫∂B(z0​,3)​ζ−wF(ζ,w)​n=0∑∞​((w−z0​)n+11​−(ζ−z0​)n+11​)(z−z0​)ndwdζ.​

If we can justify switching the sum and integral, then we are done. Observe that the sum converges uniformly, since ∣w−z0∣,∣ζ−z0∣≥1\abs{w - z_0}, \abs{\zeta - z_0} \geq 1∣w−z0​∣,∣ζ−z0​∣≥1. Also, ∣ζ−w∣≥1\abs{\zeta - w} \geq 1∣ζ−w∣≥1, by construction, and on ∂B(z0,3)\partial B\p{z_0, 3}∂B(z0​,3), we see that w↦F(ζ,w)w \mapsto F\p{\zeta, w}w↦F(ζ,w) is bounded, so we may apply Fubini's theorem to swap the inner sum and integral. By the same argument, since ζ↦F(ζ,w)\zeta \mapsto F\p{\zeta, w}ζ↦F(ζ,w) is a continuous hence bounded function on ∂B(z0,2)\partial B\p{z_0, 2}∂B(z0​,2), so we may swap again. Thus,

F(z,z)=∑n=0∞(1(2πi)2∫∂B(z0,2)∫∂B(z0,3)F(ζ,w)ζ−w(1(w−z0)n+1−1(ζ−z0)n+1) dw dζ)(z−z0)n,F\p{z, z} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty \p{\frac{1}{\p{2\pi i}^2} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 2}} \int_{\partial B\p{z_0, 3}} \frac{F\p{\zeta, w}}{\zeta - w} \p{\frac{1}{\p{w - z_0}^{n+1}} - \frac{1}{\p{\zeta - z_0}^{n+1}}} \,\diff{w} \,\diff\zeta} \p{z - z_0}^n,F(z,z)=n=0∑∞​((2πi)21​∫∂B(z0​,2)​∫∂B(z0​,3)​ζ−wF(ζ,w)​((w−z0​)n+11​−(ζ−z0​)n+11​)dwdζ)(z−z0​)n,

so FFF is holomorphic.
